newsitem.title: DENMARK: Quiet Danish bonds up a little, France in focus.
newsitem.headline: Quiet Danish bonds up a little, France in focus.

text.p: Danish bond prices rose slightly in quiet trading on Monday with dealers foreseeing little activity in a market solidly focused on France and the possibility of snap elections being called by President Chirac.
"Trade is being affected by French election rumours. We are wondering what it will mean for EMU," one dealer said.

The benchmark eight percent state bond due 2006 was up 0.04 point from the opening but still 0.30 point down from Friday's close at 109.30 yielding 6.58 percent in turnover of 905 million crowns while its June future fell 0.22 point to 108.62 with 25 contracts traded.
The six percent mortgage bond due 2026 lost 0.35 point to 87.45.
The crown traded at 3.8095 per mark at 1120 gmt, up a fraction from around 3.8100 at the opening.
The 10-year yield gap with Germany was unchanged at 73 basis points.
